message.content:
cs.LG, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NA, cs.SE

Reasoning: 
- cs.LG (Machine Learning): The paper proposes a new parallel stochastic coordinate descent algorithm for training machine learning models, and compares it to state-of-the-art machine learning solvers. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper focuses on developing a parallel algorithm that can scale to many cores and across numa nodes, and identifies system-level performance bottlenecks of the respective implementation. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper proposes a new variant of stochastic coordinate descent algorithm that is designed to avoid system bottlenecks such as limited scaling due to coherence traffic of model sharing across threads, and inefficient CPU cache accesses. 
- cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper proposes a new numerical optimization algorithm for solving large-scale machine learning problems. 
- cs.SE (Software Engineering): The paper discusses the implementation and optimization of the proposed algorithm, and compares it to existing software libraries for machine learning.
